content.description: This tough, fun sport climb ascends an arete from the bowels of a slot up into full view of the people taking the stairs to the lookout.   It's a pretty cool position, fairly protected but a little runout towards the top when the difficulty subsides.  The sequences are not obvious but if you need to work it the bolts are in good spots.
content.location: Go left of the start of the stairs down between the main rock and a detached tower.  Where the rock on the left makes a corner and there's a giant boulder to stand on you're at the start.  Climb the arete up and take the stairs back down.

content.description: Good rock, fun climb.  Sketchy to just use bolts, either bring small pieces in addition to the bolts or set up a top rope.
content.protection: Bolts and Small Pieces, Anchor at top.  Top rope possible.
content.location: Fourth bolted route from the left.  Downclimb fourth class on the right near the pipes or rappel.

climbs.name: The Muse
climbs.fa: Blaine Harman, Jeff Schenerell, Tim Slover, Franek

content.description: Crimps, jugs, sidepulls.  Lots of variations on a fun climb.
content.protection: 4 Bolts. Anchor location is far back.
content.location: 3rd route from the left.  Follow the grey streak.

content.description: Really classic, overhanging, sustained line up positive holds past about about 4 bolts to a bolted belay.  Probably the most popular line on Buck Rock, and for good reason.  It's stiff for 10a because it wont give you a break until you top it out.
content.protection: Draws.  It can be top-roped if you scramble up the class 4 where an old pipe comes down the chimney to the right.
content.location: The furthest left bolted line as viewed from the restrooms.

content.description: Start is the crux.  Go up towards the stairs and then turn left.  There is a detached little cliff in front of the main wall with three bolts for a top rope.
content.location: Easy walkoff.  From the stairs go past the pipes.
